title: Bug Spray app: First-class sidebar app for bug report management
description:
Add Bug Spray as a first-class app in the InspireHub sidebar, providing visibility into submitted bug reports.

## Design

One app with two role-based views determined by `app.isPackaged`:

### User View (packaged app)
- Read-only list of submitted reports
- Search/filter capabilities
- Status tracking (submitted → triaging → fixed)
- Transparency: users see their report status

### Dev View (development mode)
- All reports (not just own)
- Triage actions: approve, reject, prioritize
- Full context: logs, screenshots, system info
- Workflow management

## Architecture

- New app: `src/apps/bugspray/`
- Sidebar icon in shell
- Reads from `.beads/` for report data
- Uses `app.isPackaged` check to determine view mode

## Rationale

No auth/RBAC needed - build context determines role:
- Packaged app = user (read-only)
- Dev mode = developer (triage)

Completes the Bug Spray loop:
- Modal (Help → Bug Spray) = report submission
- App (sidebar) = report management
close_reason: All phases complete. Bug Spray app working with 7 user reports loading correctly.

title: QUALITY: main.js:136-183 save-file-dialog sanitizes filename but doesn't validate parent directory path - malicious renderer could provide '../../../etc/passwd.pdf' as defaultName
close_reason: Not a vulnerability. The save-file-dialog handler properly sanitizes defaultName using path.basename() (line 141) which strips any path traversal components. More importantly, dialog.showSaveDialog() is safe by design - defaultPath is only a suggested filename shown in the native OS file picker. The returned filePath is whatever location the USER actively selects through the native dialog, not a constructed path from defaultName. A malicious renderer cannot influence where files are saved because that decision is made by the user via the native OS file picker.

title: Implement User Report triage workflow: create as deferred, require human approval before bd ready
description:
## Problem
User Reports from Bug Spray could be picked up by automated fix pipelines (orchestrator/maintain) and merged without human review. This creates a security risk for malicious or bad bug reports.

## Solution
1. Bug Spray creates User Reports with status=deferred and label=needs-triage
2. Deferred issues are invisible to bd ready - automation cannot pick them up
3. Human developer runs bd list --status=deferred --label=needs-triage to find pending reports
4. After review, human approves by: bd update <id> --status=open --remove-label=needs-triage
5. Issue now appears in bd ready as a normal issue

## Implementation
- Modify Bug Spray modal submission to create issues as deferred
- Add needs-triage label to User Reports
- Document triage workflow for developers
close_reason: Implemented: Bug Spray now creates issues as deferred with needs-triage label. Added triage workflow docs to CLAUDE.md
